refnamediv.refpurpose: Sign PE binaries for EFI Secure Boot

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: systemd-sbsign can be used to sign PE binaries for EFI Secure Boot.

listitem.para: Signs the given PE binary for EFI Secure Boot. Takes a path to a PE binary as its argument. If the PE binary already has a certificate table, the new signature will be added to it. Otherwise, a new certificate table will be created. The signed PE binary will be written to the path specified with --output=.
Exports the PKCS#7 signed attributes (without a signature) to the path specified with --output=. Takes a path to a PE binary as its argument.
This command can be used to implement offline EFI secure boot signing in combination with the --signed-attributes= and --signed-attributes-signature= options for the sign verb.
Specifies the path where to write the signed PE binary.

Set the Secure Boot private key and certificate for use with the sign. The --certificate= option takes a path to a PEM encoded X.509 certificate or a URI that's passed to the OpenSSL provider configured with --certificate-source. The --certificate-source takes one of file or provider, with the latter being followed by a specific provider identifier, separated with a colon, e.g. provider:pkcs11. The --private-key= option can take a path or a URI that will be passed to the OpenSSL engine or provider, as specified by --private-key-source= as a type:name tuple, such as engine:pkcs11. The specified OpenSSL signing engine or provider will be used to sign the PE binary.
Configure the signed attributes blob (as provided by export-signed-attributes) and corresponding signature for the sign command.

example.title: Offline EFI secure boot signing of a PE binary
example.para: The following does offline secure boot signing of systemd-boot:
example.programlisting: SD_BOOT="$(find /usr/lib/systemd/boot/efi/ -name "systemd-boot*.efi" | head -n1)" /usr/lib/systemd/systemd-sbsign export-signed-attributes --certificate cert.crt --output sattrs.bin "$SD_BOOT" openssl dgst -sha256 -sign privkey.pem -out sattrs.sig sattrs.bin /usr/lib/systemd/systemd-sbsign \ sign \ --certificate cert.crt \ --output "$SD_BOOT.signed" \ --signed-attributes sattrs.bin \ --signed-attributes-signature sattrs.sig \ "$SD_BOOT"
